intro: Curcuma parvula, commonly known as dwarf turmeric, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange rhizomes. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pale yellow to white flowers atop slender stalks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, typically growing up to 30 centimeters in length. Curcuma parvula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild medicinal properties similar to its larger relatives.
